result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony K. Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony K. Gordon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony K. Gordon was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony K. Gordon

records.addlTxt: $150 plus costs & DNA surcharge due in 60 days or Civil Judgment.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Defendant Anthony K. Gordon in court.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes:  State is compliant with victim rights notification.  DE waives his right to an attorney and case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice given to DE in court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Count 1 - DE is sentenced to 2 days in the KCJ and is given credit for 2 days - TIME SERVED.    Court imposes a fine of $150 plus costs & DNA Surcharge; due in 60 days or Civil Judgment.  Appeal Rights given.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
PTC on 6/10/22 has been rescheduled to 6/24/22 @ 1:15pm per Para KL

No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Michael A,  Andrea P - 3rd party contact for pick/drop off of child and 3rd party contact for updates regarding child.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's Andrea P's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk HMcBride.   DE not eligible for SPD counsel.  DE would like to proceed without an atty.  DA PTC 6/10 1:15pm.  FPT 7/8 10am.   DE requests bond modification allow for 3rd party contact to give mother updates re: child.  Granted.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony K. Gordon
Current: 1312 Cleveland Avenue, Racine, WI 53401 United States  (Effective: 04-20-2022)
Prior: 5535 19th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53140
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
**Bond should have been a signature bond as per the Intake Court minutes.  Was typed up as cash bond.  Bond was changed to signature w/same conditions.  Sent to KCJ w/5:00 pm paperwork.**

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Michael A, Andrea P - 3rd party contact for pick/drop off of child.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's Andrea P's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Andrea P - 3rd party contact for pick/drop off of child.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's Andrea P's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case. 01:51 PM  
  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chrisopher Bub.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).    jk
